meanings.definition: The state of having two valences.
meanings.sent1: In chemistry, bivalences play a crucial role in forming compounds.
meanings.sent2: The concept of bivalences helps us understand how atoms bond.
meanings.sent3: The bivalences at the party were the oxygen and hydrogen atoms, always attracting each other.
meanings.sent4: Her bivalences with different elements made her a versatile molecule in the chemical world.
meanings.sent5: The bivalences of the elements danced together, creating new substances.

meanings.sent1: The bivalences of the element made it reactive with both metals and nonmetals.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the bivalences of elements to predict their chemical behavior.
meanings.sent3: The bivalences of the compound were so strong that it could bond with almost anything.
meanings.sent4: Her bivalences in understanding both sides of the argument made her a great mediator.
meanings.sent5: The bivalences of the atom's nature were evident in its ability to form diverse bonds.
